feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 3:54AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf through Monday Night at Shishmaref... North to northwest winds increase this morning to 20 to 35 mph with elevated surf developing west of Cape Espenberg. Waves will wash up near the top of the beach. Minor beach erosion may occur and belongings left on the beach could wash away. For the latest forecasts go to www.weather.gov/fairbanks.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 3:53AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow in the Brooks Range... Snow levels in the Brooks Range will be falling to around 2000 feet by Monday evening with up to 4 inches of accumulation expected by Tuesday morning. Temperatures will also be falling with the low temperatures in the passes falling to the uppers 20s.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northeastern Brooks Range; Northwestern Brooks Range

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 3:51AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Cool and Wet Into Mid Week... The cool and wet pattern will persist through mid week with snow levels falling to around 2000 ft by tonight. Snow is expected in the Alaska Range with snowfall amounts of 6 to 8 inches possible in Denali Park, and the Eastern Alaska Range. South winds near the Alaska Range passes will gust to 55 mph
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 7:55AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central La Paz and Maricopa Counties through 830 AM MST... At 754 AM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 19 miles southeast of Salome, or 29 miles west of Tonopah, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 5:40AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Thunderstorms Return with Heavy Rain Risk... * Another surge of monsoon moisture will yield increased thunderstorm chances through Wednesday, with potential for heavy rainfall, flash flooding, and strong outflow winds. * Today and Tuesday, there is a 25 to 50 percent chance of any one point seeing a storm. Wednesday will see chances lower as
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued August 08 at 9:47AM CDT until August 09 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Life threatening waves of 2 to 4 feet and dangerous currents are expected. * WHERE...Beaches along Lake Michigan in Sheboygan, Ozaukee, Milwaukee, Racine, and Kenosha counties.

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued August 08 at 3:26AM CDT until August 09 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...High waves and strong currents are expected as waves build to 4 to 7 ft. * WHERE...Beaches along Lake Michigan in Door, Kewaunee and Manitowoc Counties. * WHEN...Through this evening.
